headline: 2026 Super Bowl: Tom Brady is gone, but the New England Patriots are back
description: Led by young quarterback Drake Maye, who hopes to follow in the footsteps of the former NFL star, the New England franchise returns to the American football championship game on Sunday to face the Seattle Seahawks.

headline: UN prepares convention on crimes against humanity
Epstein affair: Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigns over Mandelson appointment
AI's impact on entire sectors of the economy shakes Wall Street
description: Investors have abandoned sectors like software in favor of the traditional Dow Jones, which has broken through the 50,000-point mark.

headline: PSG pound Marseille and move back to top of Ligue 1
description: Luis Enrique's Paris Saint-Germain, who beat Marseille 5-0 on Sunday, have now won seven straight league matches, though they remain under pressure from surprise challengers Lens, who briefly moved to the top slot on Saturday and sit just two points behind.

headline: French cosmetics sales drop in the US after being struck by tariffs
description: French production has struggled in the United States, its leading export market, amid competition from Korean brands.

headline: At Centre Pompidou-Metz, the late resurrection of sculptor Louise Nevelson
description: The American artist, known in the 1960s for her monumental and forbidding installations, is on display at the Moselle museum.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: 'Quad God' Malinin seals figure skating team gold for US
Israel announces measures to deepen control over West Bank
Japan's ruling party on track for an overwhelming majority in snap legislative elections
Thailand's conservative prime minister defies expectations to win general election
Iran nuclear talks: Fragile resumption of discussions between Washington and Tehran
2026 Winter Olympics: Lindsey Vonn's comeback ends in a violent crash
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
French companies cut down on drinking at work
After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
The bride wore Birkenstocks
'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
description: Europe continues to struggle to find its own voice on the international stage because it remains trapped in a cognitive dependence on Washington, writes Rosa Balfour, director of the Carnegie Europe think tank.

headline: Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
description: While he has claimed not to have the presidential election 'virus,' the leader of Les Républicains has been working on a candidacy for the 2027 election. The only questions left are how and when to announce his bid.

headline: Julian Barnes bids farewell: 'There's no such thing as a perfect novel'
description: The British writer has published what he says will be his final book, 'Departure(s)', as he celebrates his 80th birthday. He welcomed Le Monde into his home in London for a wide-ranging conversation on his career as a writer and his body of work.

headline: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image

'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
